description: This Double IPA uses premium American to row and the touch of light crystal malt to create a mellow malt foundation. 4 different hop varieties are used and it spends 1 week dry hopping in the fermenter to give it a floral, slightly piney, grapefruit & citrus aroma. Unlike most double IPA's, this beer shies away from a malty body and start out with a clean bitterness that finishes off smooth and leaves you wanting more.
name: Double Up Double IPA

description: Brewed with Falconer's Flight and Amarillo hops to exhibit notes of pine/resin and earthy characteristics.
name: Nawch Hoppa Double IPA

description:
This is our take on a double IPA. Although some would consider it somewhat ‘Belgian’ in its malt and yeast profile, we definitely crammed in all the juicy, fruity and fresh hops that any hophead could possibly wish for.

With Elliot, we tried to create a refreshing beer that’s dangerously drinkable while still maintaining that unxious mouthfeel that Struise is so renowned for. Being able to either quaffed or sipped, this is one of our most versatile multi-purpose beers.
name: Elliot Brew

description: Hayburner is a luscious and citrusy IPA, with primary notes of orange, melon, grapefruit, and a slightly earthy finish. It packs a firm bitterness but remains balanced by abundant late hop additions and a soft, airy malt base.
name: Hayburner

description: Double Daddy is triple dry-hopped and bold with notes of grapefruit, pine, and fresh pale malts.
name: Double Daddy Imperial IPA

description:
Inspired by the Great Lakes region (our big backyard), our single hop Session IPA is brewed for days when you can only guess the time based on where the sun sits in the sky.

A vibrant landscape of tropical, fruity Mosaic hop aromas and smooth sailing malt flavors
name: Steady Rollin' Session IPA

description: IPA stands for India Pale Ale and ours is an American version of the classic style. IPA's namesake lies in its colonial roots. British soldiers on their way to India drank a lot of beer, but found it would go stale on the long voyages. Meanwhile, brewers knew that by adding more hops the beer would stay fresh. Voila! A new style was born and it is one we are proud to brew. Southern Tier IPA is triple-hopped on its journey to your glass for a fully aromatic experience.
name: IPA

description:
A hazy American IPA brewed with oats and finished with Falconer's Flight, Citra and Galaxy Hops.

Hazy in color, smooth by nature and free flowing by choice.
name: Free Flow IPA

description: Happy Camper IPA is a classic beer for those beer lovers who love their hops. By masterfully combining several different hops with a very specific brewing process, we ended up with a beautifully balanced IPA. Full-bodied maltiness combined with a spicy, citric, and floral hop character, make this IPA one of our most popular beers. It's great for camping in the mountains, in the backyard, or on a bar stool.
name: Happy Camper IPA

description:
E09 Call Me Dragon DIPA is a hazy light-bodied heavily dry-hopped India Pale Ale with a softer New England style mouth feel.

E09 BEER DESIGN is our 603 brand turned upside-down, using fun and exotic ingredients in small batch brews.
name: E09 Call Me Dragon DIPA

description: This New England Style IPA (Hazy IPA) is super juicy with tropical notes of blueberry, pineapple, melon, citrus, and pine. These amazing flavors and aromas come from our generous use of Mosaic, Huell Melon, Galaxy, Citra, and Vic Secret hops. Please do not attempt to drive an awesome Orange vehicle after consuming.
name: Hops of Hazzard Hazy IPA

description: This single-hopped DIPA showcases the Mosaic hop, aptly named for the "mosaic" of flavors it contributes to any beer. Ours has a pleasant blend of tropical fruit, citrus, and piney flavors, as well some juicy characteristics.
name: Mosaic Double IPA

description: A medium-bodied and well hopped India pale ale with a dry, fruity finish. Named in honor of the hero of the Battle of Lake Erie during the War of 1812. "Don't Give Up the Sip!"
name: Commodore Perry IPA

description: Extensively dry-hopped double IPA. Second Fiddle is second in name only. It’s big, juicy and aromatic. Citrus, Tropical, Pine
name: Second Fiddle

description: Pours very hazy with a straw yellow color. Aroma and flavor are bursting with orange peel, lime, spruce, and papaya from the Azacca and Ekuanot hops.
name: Experimental IPA #5: Azakuanot Hazy IPA

description: Hopped with six different American hop varieties and five lbs. of hops per barrel, this triple IPA has aromas of orange marmalade, ripe melon, & lemon zest. The flavor is full of rich orange flesh with herbal piney jabs that linger endlessly.
name: Matriarch

description: Our Double IPA, The Seaward is brewed with all “C” Hops: Cascade, Centennial, Chinook and Columbus. Reminiscent of brews from the Pacific Northwest, this beer contains hints of pine, grapefruit, citrus and spice balanced with a malty body.
name: The Seaward DIPA

description: Brewed with NW malted barley and an abundance of oats, then hopped with mosaic, El Dorado, Vic Secret, Bru-1, and a pinch of citra. Its insanely robust mouthfeel tastes like you’re drinking juice and finishes with a wall of fruity hops
name: P-Factor Hazy IPA

description: Introducing West Coast Vermonting DIPA. Not only is this our first ever packaged Double IPA, but it is a nod to some of the great brewers from Vermont with our West Coast twist. WCV is a cryo hopped DIPA using simcoe and mosaic and fermented with Vermont Ale Yeast. Orange and Pineapple surround each sip. We once again teamed up with our friend Dean McKeever to create this beautiful Art Hop series illustration for the label.
name: West Coast Vermonting DIPA

description: Bright and intense with a vivid hop punch. For this bold take on the IPA tradition, we were inspired by the indomitable Capt. James Cooke whose 3rd voyage made him the first to navigate a treacherous route from England to New Zealand to the Pacific Northwest. Using Cascade hops from each of these regions we created a brew that’s citrusy, earthy, and full of bold character.
name: Samuel Adams Third Voyage

description:
Our India Pale Ale is a new take on this highly popularized style. Citrus is the obvious star. Over the backbone of bready malt and pine stickiness you will find notes of peaches, lemon zest, danky grassiness, pine needles, and tangerines. Each sip is followed by a dangerously drinkable amount of resinous glamour.

HOPS: Cascade, Centennial, Columbus, Citra
MALTS: 2-Row, Honey, Cara, Dextrin, Flaked Barley
YEAST: House
name: West Sixth IPA

description:
Raised by an avid IPA drinker, there was no way Donald could not give reference to his dad, Don Staas Sr. for this brew. Drink up senior!

Tasting Notes: A big and balanced amber colored beer with waves of hop flavor, aroma, and moderate to high bitterness. This brew is generously dry hopped with Citra hops and is always fresh to our tap to highlight its great aroma.
name: Senior Status

description:
Classic West Coast Style DIPA.

The hop varieties vary between batches and you'll also see a slight variance in abv from time to time.

Blend of 2-row and sucrose.
name: Sand Dollar DIPA

description: Fresh and lively hop character is delivered from using 5 distinct varieties of hops; Tettnang, Centennial, Chinook, Cascade and Amarillo. This beer has an intense hop bitterness balanced by moderate fruity esters and medium malt character. 10% abv. & 83 IBU’s
name: Swamp Ape DIPA

description: Surf’s up with our “HI-10” Mango Habanero Double IPA. With citra waves for days, and just enough heat to make you sweat, our big and juicy DIPA has plenty of kick to keep you barreled from start to finish.
name: HI-10 (Side Project Volume 27)

description: Our American IPA has big, bold hop flavor from American-grown hops and is deep golden and full bodied. Made with large quantities of 2 row and Crystal malted barley, this beer is an American, scaled-up version of its cousin style, English IPA. Flavored with the American hops, Amarillo, Centennial and Simcoe, this beer has pronounced bitterness and very prominent aromas of citrus and fruit.
name: American IPA (AIPA)

description: Meet the newest generation in our questing single hop line! Fermented with our expressive yeast and hopped exclusively with Citra hops, we're stoked to share the Questing: Citra with everyone. With a bright citrus aroma, and notes of mango, tangelo, and peach throughout, this beer delivers the juicy goods.
name: Questing: Citra Single Hop Hazy IPA

description: At a lower ABV, this India pale ale is designed to be enjoyed by all. It's subtle malt character is highlighted with a hop bill featuring nugget, cascade, ahtanum and sorachi ace.
name: Session IPA

description:
Our third NW DIPA features the 4820th generation of our local JW Lees yeast. We added Huell Melon and Amarillo to the whirlpool, with Citra, Amarillo, Loral, and Huell Melon in the dry hop.

The NW DIPA style showcases yeast from some of Manchester’s oldest family brewers and fresh harvest hops.
name: NW DIPA Citra Amarillo

description: Enchanting Orange Marmalade and ripe pineapple notes resonate from the glass of our very drinkable Double IPA. This malt forward brew has slight caramel notes on the palate and finishes with just the right amount of bitterness and a hint of spice.
name: Run Double IPA

description: LOUD! Hazy Double IPA always uses its outside voice. Obnoxiously dry-hopped with Mosaic and Denali, LOUD! screams with tropical flavors of mango, papaya and pineapple and has a crazy hazy mouthfeel.
name: LOUD! Hazy DIPA

description: Cerveja do estilo New England IPA. Fermentada com Conan. Medalha de Ouro no Mondial de La Biere 2016.
name: Hazy

description: El Guapo — which, translated, means “the handsome one” — looks sexy, smells beautiful, and tastes great! It is a medium-bodied, agave-infused India Pale Ale, with a grassy, citrus nose and notes of sweet caramel, that finishes with a smooth but strong bitterness.
name: El Guapo Agave IPA

description: Northwest-Style IPA. Citrus, tropical, and pine hops meet a balanced malt background. Multi time Great American Beer Festival medal winner.
name: Pallet Jack IPA™

description:
Our very first, limited edition hazy beer was made just for our beach-dwelling buddies down south. HazeMan is a hazy IPA made with a smattering of hops and a bit of unmalted wheat for a little extra fog.

We started with Cashmere hops in the mash, then stacked the whole brew day with hops on hops, ending it all with whole leaf hops, and of course, more hops while dry hopping. Ekuanot, Cashmere, Denali, and Mosaic varietals add a tropical fruit salad of flavors in the form of papaya, melon, lime, coconut, pineapple, pine, and berry notes.

This one's for you, San Diego!
name: HazeMan Hazy IPA

description:
We teamed up with a San Diego favorite of ours – Pizza Port, for a Day One of epic preportions. When we first talked we wanted the label to be an homage to Thrilla the Gorilla – whom many of you may remember from T&C Surf designs. We were even more excited when we reached out to Thrilla’s creator, Steve Nazar and he offered to create a brand new character for us. And with “The Chicken” being such a big thing in San Diego, Surfin’ Bird was born.

This Double IPA is based on a hop cocktail we are really in love with (we brewed a test batch in San Clemente), Citra, Loral, and Idaho 7. It’s all lemon cream, stone fruit, and some tropical stuff going on with a light undercurrent of dankness.
name: Surfin' Bird Double IPA

description: Enjoy a So Cal summer year-round with Tangerine Soul Style IPA. This delectable brew is one way ticket to taste bud paradise. Relax and take in the brilliant, golden-orange color and fresh aroma of effervescent tangerine and orange. Tangerine zest carries throughout, accented by bright, flowery, tropical flavors and a sweet finish. Brewed with American caramel malts and a blend of Simcoe, Citra, and Cascade hops, this is a beautiful brew to behold.
name: Tangerine Soul Style IPA

description: This lighter bodied, golden-hued, hazy IPA features Mosaic, Cashmere, and Centennial hops that merge melon, lime, and mango-like hop characters into a bold expressionistic IPA with a kick.
name: Hy-Wire Hazy IPA

description: An aggressively hopped West Coast-style IPA. Union Jack showcases exceptional dry hop character with stunning pineapple, citrus and piney aromas on the nose accompanied by honey-like malt aromatics. Double dry hopping brings bold grapefruit, tangerine and citrus flavors that are contrasted by pale malt sweetness to balance this intense brew. A true tribute to the style that put the West Coast on the craft beer map.
name: Union Jack IPA

description: Com dose superior de lúpulo, Madalena Double IPA se destaca por possuir o característico amargor acentuado do estilo, mas de forma equilibrada, sem agressividade. Possui cítrico pronunciado, coloração âmbar e espuma bastante cremosa. Não é pasteurizada.
name: Madalena Double IPA

description: INDIA PALE ALE Brewed with marshmallows, graham crackers, salt and lactose sugar with mango and vanilla added
name: Shploing!!

description: The core of every great IPA are hops that give it its heart and soul. Hop commander IPA gets its name from ultimate hop harvesting vehicle, and pays tribute to the ingenuity, creativity and hard work of the hop farmer.
name: Hop Commander

description: A unique twist on Modus Hoperandi, this citrus IPA is dry-hopped with a generous portion of Mandarina Bavaria hops and brewed with sweet orange peels.
name: Modus Mandarina

description: This west coast style IPA is our flagship beer. We can talk about IPAs and hops all day but you better just give it a run for yourself.
name: Apocalypse IPA

description: Suspense has been brewed true to its US East Coast IPA style - hazy, juicy, scarcely bitter. For a uniquely Kiwi version, we've hopped it with 100% NZ hops. The naturally inspired haze comes from a lashing of protein rich cereals, lending a smooth and silky mouthfeel to this US inspired brew.
name: Suspense

description: Deep golden with subtle orange hues, Maniacal® Double IPA perfectly balances hop bitterness, pine and citrus aromatics, and malt structure. It satisfies even the strongest hop cravings while remaining balanced enough for the DIPA skeptic.
name: Maniacal® IPA

description:
Everybody loves a great IPA, and this one will have you coming back for more. The key to this beer is that we used actual dinosaurs bones. Okay, that was a lie. But we did throw enough hops in here to bury a Brontosaurus. Inspired by some of our favorite West Coast IPAs the bold pine, citrus, peach, and tangerine hop flavors along with a clean bitterness are balanced by that velvety malt backbone. This beautiful blend of flavor and drinkability showcases the truly unique Eureka! hops, which we find to be wonderfully juicy and dank. If you want a brew that'll scratch your hop itch, you've come to the right place. You don't need tiny arms and a huge head to enjoy this mammoth IPA!

2016 Alltech Commonwealth Cup Bronze Medal Winner

2016 Best Little Brewfest in Texas Silver Medal Winner
name: Dankosaurus

description: This is our Double IPA. It features bold fruity aromatics commonly associate with American IPAs. It contains a ton of hops including Citra and Equinox. As far as DIPAs go this one is light-bodied with an easy finish.
name: Fat Boys

description: Every year we anxiously await the warmer months to unleash this Double IPA, the summer edition of our former YuleSmith seasonals. The flavor imparts orange, grapefruit, and tangerine hop notes with earthy, spicy, and resinous pine undertones. A sturdy malt backbone balances out the profound hop bitterness to create a refreshingly assertive and vibrant beer that offers an unapologetically bold expression of fresh American hops.
name: Double IPA

description: A juicy New-England style IPA brewed with a golden naked oats and triple dry hopped with Nelson Sauvin, Centennial and Citra hops
name: Hazy IPA

description:
This Hazy DIPA was brewed with some of the freshest Galaxy, Citra, Nelson & Wakatu we could get our hands on! Notes of freshly zested citrus, gooseberries, crushed tropical fruits and a touch of resiny dankness. Clocking in at 9.2%, this is sure to be a crowd pleaser!

Cheers to our sales rep Nate Steen for two years of hard work and making Goldwater what it is today!
name: Wicked Cloudy

description:
‘The sky is falling! The beer is pouring!’ We’ve been saving this name for Batch 100, our first Imperial IPA. Huge aromas of ripe melons and orange pith lead the way with citrus, peaches, and a touch of alcohol warmth to wash down the warnings of impending doom. Double dry-hopped with coveted hops, this one is worth the alarm: run and tell your friends about it.

Malts: GW Org 2 Row, MFB Special Aromatic, Weyermann CaraFoam.

Hops: Summit and Cascade; finished with Summit, Org Cascade, Simcoe, Aus Galaxy, Golding, Amarillo, Centennial and Mosaic
name: Chicken Little DIPA

description: Our classic West Coast inspired Double IPA starts with a nose full of bright lemon zest and mild spruce. On the palette, the pine lends a spicy overtone supported by a sweet citrus balance. It finishes crisp and clean with a tight bitterness that dissipates shortly after. This beer has layers of hops unfolding as you enjoy it due to the multiple additions throughout the process giving it a character that sets it apart from the rest.
name: Dos Más DIPA

description: Lost Horizon is a double IPA featuring Centennial, Chinook, Simcoe, and Calypso hops. It’s definitely on the piney/citrusy/resinous end of the spectrum, quite different from our other hoppy offerings.
name: Lost Horizon

description:
Well Balanced, a bit on the bitter side, but nothing overwhelming. Dry hopped with Mosaic and Citra giving it a nice citrusy flavor. The name Laplander comes from 1940's train lingo stating that when a passenger is jostled into someone else's lap in a crowded car.

Drink a few and you might end up in someones lap! Cheers!!
name: Laplander DIPA

description:
Heroically hopped golden IPA with strong notes of tropical fruit and dry finish.
Defender IPA is the official beer of New York Comic Con.
name: Defender IPA

description:
Voggy and hazy India Pale Ale brewed with Mosaic, Citra, and Denali hops, and fermented with London III and Sacc Brux Trios.

Appearance: Opaque, hazy, pale golden

Aroma: Tangerine, mango, pineapple, pine

Flavor: Soft tropical fruit, citrus and piney with moderate bitterness
name: Lava Love Hazy IPA

description: This hazy IPA is double dry hopped with mosaic and azacca hops, layered over a base of pale malt and a bunch of wheat. Big aromas of mango and papaya up front, finishing with juicy tangerines and pillow fights. That's right, pillow fights. But this isn’t just another chloride-heavy, overly sweet juice bomb. This is a hazy IPA with some West Coast sensibility.
name: Mozacca Hazy IPA

description: Mosaic, Pallisades, Zeus, Galaxy, Nugget, Wakatu, and Ahatnum hops make this a big beer with a huge hop profile
name: Cone Flakes IIPA

description: This beer is a true West Coast-style Double IPA made with huge amounts of hops - both in the kettle for flavor and later in the torpedo to impart a massive hop aroma. The light malt body and dry finish hide the power in this immensely drinkable hop-bomb.
name: Audition Double IPA

description: The first beer in the atomic series. DIPA brewed with Azacca, Simcoe and Lemon drop hops. Dry hopped with Azacca and simcoe. Pleasant tropical fruit notes, Juicy and drinkable.
name: Proton

description: A Double IPA heavily hopped with over 4 lbs/bbl of Simcoe, Magnum, Nugget and Ahtanum. This is a big, malty ale with delicate hop and rich malt aroma, complex hop flavor and sustained smooth hop bitterness. Hops are added from beginning to end during the brewing process and made using over 80% USDA certified organic ingredients.
name: (512) TWO

description: We're leaning all in on the hazy game with this big fruit bomb of a DIPA. Hopped to high heaven with El Dorado, then finished with a combination of Jarrylo, Monroe, and Huell Melon, Huckster is a fruit salad in a glass. The aroma gives off intense orange peel and orange syrup, while the flavor showcases more delicate supporting fruits of strawberry, honeydew, raspberry, and papaya. It pours with a beautiful deep golden haze, and the yeast in suspension add a creamy mouthfeel that help this beer go down smooth despite the 8.9% ABV. Moderate bitterness and an off-dry finishing keep things refreshing so you can have more than one in a sitting, but be careful -- that Huckster might try to push itself on you!
name: Huckster Hazy DIPA

description: Sound Wave carries her drinker to the West Coast, to the golden shores of California where craft ale is nectar. She is the driest of Siren's ales with a bitterness that bites, but she is balanced with full flavour. Her resinous finish will pull you off balance.
name: Sound Wave IPA

description: Our flagship - 2010 World Beer Cup gold medal award - brewed and hopped with American, Centennial, Cascades, Columbus and Simcoe hops
name: Norm's Raggedy Ass IPA

description: An IPA created with generous amounts of wheat and a mountain of experimental 331, mosaic, and Amarillo hops, Geodesic is at once assertive, complex, and massively refreshing, with big resinous flavors and aromas complemented by a boatload of tropical fruit character. It's an intesely delicious combo that handily maintains the difficult balance of intriguing complexity and serious crushability.
name: Geodesic

description: Legendary, like the beast itself! English style Double IPA, loaded with whole Cascade and Columbus hop cones to a whopping 99 IBU then perfectly balanced with our mix of all imported malts.
name: Sasquatch Double IPA

description: Weighing in at 8% ABV, Monsoon is the rare breed of Double IPA that remains extremely juicy yet uncharacteristically refreshing. The initial aroma is a relentless grappling match between the juicy ruby red grapefruit notes of Mosaic hops and the sweet tangerine notes of the Mandarina hops. A mellow malt profile and moderate bitterness wash the constantly evolving hop profile across the palate so you can experience the nuance of these newly released hops and forget that you are drinking a beer of this size.
name: Monsoon

description: Papa silenus is a double IPA with enormous hop character delightfully balanced between fruity and dank. The hop blend used in the kettle creates firm bitterness and enormous tropical/citrus notes. Simcoe and amarillo reappear in the dry hop, along with a heavy-handed dose of comet to create a deeply resinous aroma and flavor.
name: Papa Silenus

description: American Double IPA dry hopped with Simcoe, Meridian, Cascade, Centennial, and Sorachi Ace. Assertive hops presence with intense citrus and pine notes. Honey helps provide balance. Full bodied Double IPA.
name: Hop-Eating Grin DIPA

description: This big mouth watering Double India Pale Ale boasts a vibrant orange color in the glass. Breathe in deeply the scent of floral-fruity confections. Flavors of tropical fruits and candied citrus zest lead the way to a lightly piney finish. All balanced with a residual sweetness that matches the subtle spiced bitterness.
name: Mule Fuel

description: "Resin" is named after the sticky ooze that secretes from the lupulin glands of the hop cone.
name: Resin

description:
Double India Pale Ale
This beer was brewed for Nat Reeves, the electro-synth composing, pink tee shirt wearing, hop wizard of Cheltenham. If you don't know who he is, then you should probably not drink this beer. Go have a pint of ambergris.
name: DIPA

description: A celebration of Brewfontaine's first anniversary and of the repeal of Ohio's ABV limit on beer. Citrus aromas of grapefruit, orange, and lime blend well with flavors of pine and cedar. This beer is bolder than anything North High has ever created.
name: Danke Imperial IPA

description: Confident that the brewing team would develop an outstanding single IPA, the name “Soul Style” refers to the grace of the rarely seen, soul style surfer who leans way back on the board, making each difficult maneuver appear effortless. Soul Style is the Green Flash approach the art of crafting the perfect IPA. Citra, Simcoe and Cascade hops are layered to allow bright tropical citrus to mingle with waves of floral notes that break gently on the palate.
name: Soul Style

description: They say some of the best inventions were created by mistake. That was certainly the case with Hardywood Belgian DIPA. Originally intended as the base beer for Hoplar, our wood aged American-style double IPA, this beer was fermented with the Belgian abbey-style ale yeast we use with Hardywood Singel. The resulting beer offers the assertive hoppy bitterness of Hoplar with the fruity, spicy character of Singel. An accident, yes, but a delicious one, indeed!
name: Belgian DIPA

description: This Hazy IPA is anything but expected. Like the chain of islands that inspired it, there is something to be discovered around every corner. Bold citrus aromas and flavours lead to a lingering, juicy finish.
name: Broken Islands Hazy IPA

description:
A monster bitterness, with huge hop aromas, imparting tropical, floral orange peel citrus notes which continue into the flavour, resulting in an exciting, complex character and long-lasting finish. Malt: Pale.
HOPS: Challenger, Pilgrim, First Gold, Target, Styrian, Cascade.
name: Double Hop Monster IPA

brewery: Red Horn Coffee House and Brewing Co.
description: Give me That Hazy Galaxy IPA. Brewed with loads of Malted Oats, Flaked Wheat and Barley, and Pilsner Malt, That Hazy Galaxy IPA is cloudy and thick AF, yet still drinks incredibly easily, especially considering its 7.5% ABV. 100% Galaxy hopped, we crammed over 5# per barrel of that juicy, fruity, tropical Australian flower into this experimental IPA. We fermented with Saccharomyces Bruxellensis Trois, a relatively new and unique strain, to add a slight over ripened fruit funk that we feel is a beautiful compliment to the hops.
name: That Hazy Galaxy IPA

description: Paying homage to the true New England Style Double IPA's, the Hazy Husky is fermented with Conan yeast, lots of Citra, Mosaic and Galaxy hops added at whirlpool and dry hopped to give the distinctive juicy character with a silky mouthfeel from all the hop resins and multiple types of malts.
name: Hazy Husky New England Style DIPA

description: This Double IPA is bursting at the seams with flavor! We didn't hold back on the hops with this one, so be prepared for full-on citrus and mango aromas finishing with a ton of grapefruit and tropical fruit in the flavor. With a light and balanced malt body, the hops shine through creating a bold, hoppy brew.
name: Phantom Taxi

description: Brewed in collaboration with our friend at The Answer Brewing in RVA. Made with Mosaic and Idaho 7 hops and our house yeast.
name: Momentary Inception DIPA

description: Assertive, hop forward IPA. Juicy aromas, and a fresh, dry finish. Hopped with Simcoe, Citra, Columbus, and Calypso.
name: The Kragle IPA

description: Named after the Greek god of clouds, Zeus, is Hazy gold in color with medium body. We feature Citra as the main hop in the brew, but back it up with Simcoe and Mosaic goodness. We like to call this our POG beer as it has passion fruit, orange and guava notes.
name: Zeus

description: Hazealicious IPA is juicy, with a soft bitterness, providing a perfect balance for a hazy IPA. Tropical aromas, particularly kiwi and passionfruit, come from a bold blend of Citra, Strata, and Mosaic hops. The show-stopping hops are balanced and gently restrained by a pillowy malt body.
name: Hazealicious

description: A beautifully crafted, bright, and juicy IPA brewed with grapefruit, blood orange, and loads of late additions american hops.
name: Citrus IPA

description: Hunting the fields during hop harvest, we were stopped in our tracks by the otherworldly lemon notes of a hop called Lemondrop. We just had to build a beer around it. Our HopCyclone circulates Lemondrop’s citrusy oils throughout Golden Thing, and dry-hopping with Lemondrop and Centennial leads to juicy layers of fresh lemonade, pinesap, and sweet citrus.
name: Golden Thing

description: Twin Cannons (aka Cease Fire) is our double IPA. This is a big, malty and hoppy beer. Thanks to the Chinook hops this double IPA has a fruity Apricot/Peachy front end and a hop character that you would expect from a balanced double IPA.
name: Twin Cannons DIPA (aka Cease Fire DIPA)

description: Our hoppiest beer ever, this DIPA is bursting with Galaxy, Motueka, Idaho 7, and El Dorado hops. Huge flavors of melon, mango, and passionfruit
name: Year 4 DIPA

description: Named after the Vermont Ale Yeast strain used in the beer, Conan’s Haze combines two of our favorite hops, Mosaic and Simcoe, with healthy doses of wheat, Pilsen malt, and flaked oats and barley. This NE inspired IPA is not as hazy as most, but carries Barbarian bold tangerine, grapefruit, passion fruit and lychee flavors along with an approachable hop finish.
name: Conan’s Haze Hazy IPA

description: Ready to take it to the next level? This DIPA is fueled by hop flavor and aroma with enough bitterness to back the big malt body. Enjoy responsibly, this one's aptly named
name: Baby Maker

description: Extremamente aromática e saborosa esta double IPA utiliza a melhor combinação de lúpulos americanos para criar uma explosão cítrica.
name: Citrus Bomb

description: This classic, golden-hued ale is brewed with the finest hand-selected hops from the Pacific Northwest for an assertive, citrus hop flavor.
name: India Pale Ale

description:
If it’s hazy, does that mean it’s unfiltered? (Most likely.) And what does New England have to do
with it? (Not necessarily anything.) With a commitment to higher beer education, Flying Dog
University is breaking down the trend of unfiltered IPAs right into your glass. As hops have more
interaction with the yeast, which would normally be removed before filtration, you get aroma
and flavor profiles that are different than your average filtered IPA.
name: Flying Dog University Night School Hazy IPA

description: Soft, unfilitered wheat backdrop that accentuates the Pacific Northwest hop character.
name: Honeyspot Road IPA

description: An LA Hazy IPA, light to medium-bodied, hazy golden in color, with flavors and aromas of tropical fruit, pine, and citrus, with a pleasantly dry finish.
name: Hazy LA IPA

description: juicy, hazy, tropical IPA bursting with aromas of pineapple, orange and mango. A velvety smooth mouthfeel, yet dry finish. Loaded with galaxy, Simcoe and El Dorado hops
name: Ray Ray Hazy IPA

description: This special hop-forward ale featuring Mosaic and whole leaf Apollo is both fruity and dank. We hope you enjoy our hoppy twist on the taste of freedom.
name: Escape To Colorado IPA

description:
Gyle No. 427. In March 2016 we devoted a third of our cellar capacity to a single beer, DIPA v3. We are excited to brew it again as faithfully as we can to the original recipe. Hot side additions see the return of whole cone, new season Chinook and Citra hops, followed by an 8 g/L cold side dry hop, featuring Centennial, Citra, Mosaic, and Comet. It was fermented with WLP095 instead of the original Vermont ale yeast. 8.5% ABV

Aroma Hops: Centennial, Citra, Mosaic, Comet
Bittering Hop: Pilgrim CO2 Alpha Extract
Malts: Golden Promise
Yeast: WLP095
name: DIPA v3 2018

description: A truly unique style featuring a strong hop finish on a silky body. A filtered pale wheat ale that is great for both IPA and wheat beer fans.
name: A Little Sumpin' Sumpin' Ale
Trial by Haze #6: Hazy IPA w/ Mosaic, Citra, Sorachi Ace, and Ekuanot

description: Double IPA with mosaic hops and Honey. Tropical fruit, citrus and floral flavors and aroma of a single hop. The malt is simple and lends a drier and refreshing IPA
name: Night Game

description:
Did you know that Oktoberfest actually starts in September? But, we have been pretty busy and won’t have this ready till October... our bad. And, this beer is not actually an Oktoberfest beer (or Märzen, a full bodied german lager). Instead, it is a hazy IPA with all German Malt (Weyermann, ist gut malz) that's been hopped with German Hallertau Blanc and Mandarina Barvaria. All of this makes for a fruity and juicy Hazy IPA. Rip the Lid off one. If you wish to put a couple of them into a stein we won’t hold it against you.

Hopfen und malz, gott erhalt's.

Prost!
name: Hoptoberfest Hazy German IPA

description: Brewed with the hop aficionado in mind, Fat Tug is a Northwest-style India Pale Ale with an intense hop profile featuring notes of grapefruit, mango, melon and passionfruit. Sufficient malt is there to provide support. At 7% alc/vol and 80+ IBUs this beer delivers on the promise to satisfy anyone with a thirst for all things hoppy!
name: Fat Tug IPA

description:
This unique India Pale Ale features our favorite hops—Simcoe®, Amarillo® and Nugget. A generous Amarillo and Simcoe dry hop provide for an assertive, hop-forward nose and front palate. We don’t use traditional bittering hops in our IPA, providing nothing but stimulating citrus and floral characteristics.

Inspired by a recipe from our good friend and fellow homebrewer Tim from the North Shore Homebrewers Club.
name: IPA

description: Brewed as the 2,000th beer for Pete’s Brass Rail (Danville). This light bodied double IPA was brewed to especially showcase the tropical citrus notes from Mosaic and experimental hop 5256. This beer is clean, light, and drinkable. Take your taste buds on a drive thru the hop wash!
name: Hop Wash

description: This lupulin-ladin India Pale Ale is packed with juicy tropical fruit character, bright floral aromas and delectable layers of hop flavor. Pour mindfully, inhale deeply and enjoy a tropical vacation in a glass. Always store cold, enjoy fresh and stay cool!
name: Sip of Sunshine

description: Our all new Double IPA. West coast style with Amarillo, chinook, nugget, and Columbus hops. Drinks easy, punches hard.
name: Hopry

description:
Batch #003 of Tavour's Beer Buddies Series
A hazy double IPA with Mosaic, Comet, Azacca and Citra hops for a punch of juicy citrus and tropical fruit.
name: Crushed in the Mail

description: The double amount of hops causes a real taste explosion! This IPA is recommended for true lovers.
name: DIPA

description: Milkshake IPA brewed with malted oats and wheat and hopped with Citra and Mosaic. Conditioned atop a melange of Madagascar vanilla beans, kiwi, & strawberry purées and a heavy dosing of cardamom all evoking the flavors of the classic meringue dessert from Down Under, Pavlova.
name: Milkshake IPA (Double Pavlova)

description:
Not all roads lead to our brewery and restaurant, but our local Route 1A certainly does! Our namesake Double IPA is sure to be the ale that will “take you away”.

The use of bready, biscuity malts serve as the on-ramp to flavor, while the citrusy aromas extracted from Ahtanum, Amarillo, and Mandarina hops lend to its heady bouquet.
name: Route 1A Double IPA

description: This juicy IPA was developed in our “underground” basement brewery. Shh…don’t ask about what was happening in the basement, but the beer flows out of the tap a deep persimmon with fluffy khaki foam. The only dank aroma emanating from this basement is one of earthy tones, juicy citrus and a hint of lemongrass all derived from Citra hops. Basement IPA is balanced with a nice malty body that creates a sweet finish and developed hop notes in every sip. There is a hint of alcohol heat on the way down for this hop forward Northeast style IPA. Beer geeks rejoice but you have to leave your parent’s basement because for now Basement IPA is only at your local establishment.
name: Basement IPA

description:
Substantial amounts of late-kettle hop additions and dry-hopping yields a heady blend of fruity aromas of pineapple, peach and citrus. Those aromas continue into a crisply bitter hop presence across the tongue, but the judicious use of toasted and caramel specialty malts prevents the hop intensity from overwhelming the palate.

Locally sourced Michigan honey creates a smooth, dry finish that pulls everything together.

The India Red Ale style is a variation on the IPA, but with more caramel and toasted malt character and a reddish hue.

Roundhouse was first brewed at our original brewery in downtown Kalamazoo in 2009.
name: Roundhouse

description: This IPA is created from a base of pale and crystal malts and is aggressively hopped throughout the brewing process with a final hop addition in the conditioning vessel. A beautiful flowery hop aroma will greet you as you dive into this hop lover's dream. A middle caramel malt presence balances high hop bitterness with hop flavor end to end.
name: Nectar IPA
Head Full of Dynomite v.4: Hazy IPA w/ Mosaic Cryo, Centennial, Sorachi Ace, and El Dorado

description: Why are Miracle Mike and his Kangaroo, Boomer, being chased by blue laser beam shooting cupcakes and two giant layer cake mother ships? Let’s just say it’s an intergalactic walkabout turned ding bat wonky. To commemorate this weird alter-dimensional variation of Space Cake, we used Vic Secret hops from Australia to dry hop, giving a bright grapefruit note to our favorite DIPA. Enjoy, Jackaroos and Jillaroos!
name: Vic Secret Space Cake

description: A full-flavored American Double IPA, hopped with Simcoe, Amarillo, Cascade, Citra and Galena.
name: Jigawatts DIPA

description:
This‘känvə loodəd ‘hāzē IPA was inspired by the great, hazy and juicy IPA's made in New England. We didn't lose our way on this interpretation of the style, as ours features Mosaic and Citra Hops and is our own!

We aren't inspired by their football, but their IPA's aren't half bad!
name: Convoluted And Hazy IPA (‘känvə loodəd ‘hāzē)

description: Hops are the name of the game with a Double IPA, but we knew we had to take it one step further. With Hop Bullet, we’re using a new technique, hitting the beer with a double-barreled blast of Magnum hops and lupulin dust—pure, concentrated hop flavor—directly into the tank to emphasize the intense pine and citrus flavors of classic West Coast hops.
name: Hop Bullet Double IPA

description: A hazy, juicy IPA with the aroma of a hopped up IPA, but without the harsh bite. Loaded with hops with citrus and tropical fruit flavors.
name: Minute Man NE IPA

description:
Without a doubt, the boldest and hoppiest mother of a brew Silver City has ever created. More than 50 lbs of Washington State Cascade and Columbus hops are infused, injected or otherwise inflicted upon a single 15 barrel batch. Welcome to hop country!

http://www.silvercity.beer/year-rounds/
name: Whoop Pass Double IPA

description: Collaboration brew first made for the 2017 RateBeer Summer Gathering in Boise, Idaho. Barley Brown's and Sockeye came together to make an amazing IPA.
name: First Rate B.S. Hazy IPA

description: What makes a great leader? First of all a perfectly balanced blend of qualities; the ability to stand out - be authoritative without overpowering. Show courage and endurance - you lead the way and set standards. Very important; be appealing and to the people. This stereotypical portrait applies whether referring to politics, religion or maybe even this outstanding IPA.
name: Falco

description:
First came ‘Power of the Voodoo’ TIPA, then ‘White Knuckle’ White IPA and now in our 3rd collaboration with the mighty Boneyard Brewing from Bend, Oregon we give you ‘Bloody Notorious – Blood Orange DIPA’.

Tony the brew master from Boneyard was due to swing by the UK on his travels to Copenhagen CBC. So we took the opportunity to brew another beast of an IPA. We both have a love of all things green and resinous so we put our minds together to create another hop monster. Our first collaboration, Power of the Voodoo was all about the hop. Our second, White Knuckle was about the dance between fruit infusion (dried limes and orange zest) and hops. For our 3rd, Tony suggested experimenting more with fruit/zest so I described our Bloody ‘Ell IPA to him and the process we go through and suggested why not blend our recipe with his awesome Notorious TIPA giving us the mighty ‘Bloody Notorious DIPA!’ So that is exactly what we did. Both base grain recipes were similar in construction. The hop bill comprised of shed loads of Citra, Amarillo and Mosaic and we doubled the Bloody ‘Ell infusion rate of the blood oranges into the brew.

We have created the juiciest of bangers. From ashes of Bloody ‘Ell rises the new rule of a beer that is just plain notorious. Please be upstanding for Bloody Notorious.
name: Bloody Notorious

description: Our single hop IPA is heavily dry hopped with Mosaic hops. Clean and crisp with an incredible balance between juicy fruit flavors and hop bitterness.
name: Mosaic IPA

description: Super juicy New England style Hazy IPA brewed in collaboration with Tombstone Brewing. Fresh orange peels and a hint of natural vanilla.
name: Orange You Glad It’s Hazy
S:t Eriks & Mathias Dahlgren Winter DIPA

description: This specialty craft beer was a collaboration with Fort George Brewery of Astoria, OR. Grambrinus pilsner malt, flaked oats and carahell 55 malt in the grist met up with three hop doses in the kettle, including larger late additions and Eldorado and Azacca as dry hops. An ESB yeast helps the malt stay front and center, because, well, did we mention that they added some hops?
name: A River Runs Through It: Hop Shake IPA

description: Blind Pig IPA was originally brewed by Vinnie at Blind Pig Brewing Co. in Temecula CA. Inspired by the original Blind Pig IPA, this beer is loaded with hop character but only has 6.0% ABV.
name: Blind Pig IPA

description: Aggressively dry hopped and rich in hop flavor and aroma, Hale’s Supergoose IPA is nonetheless well balanced and drinkable. If you love IPA’s you gotta try Supergoose.
name: Supergoose IPA

description: 8 marvelous hops for 8 marvelous years! In celebration of Beachwood BBQ's 8th anniversary, we brewed this bodacious double IPA. An endlessly complex flavor and aroma profile comes from: Chinook, Warrior, Citra, Nelson Sauvin, Equinox, Azacca, Belma, & Mosaic hops.
name: Beachwood Eight

description: Brewed with oats and Pennsylvania wildflower honey. Transcendentally hopped with Mosaic, Simcoe, and Amarillo. Peachy. Notes of mango jam, blueberries, grapefruit zest, resin, and meadow flowers.
name: Pineal

description: A bonifide hop-head’s delight. This is a beer truly bursting at the seams with juicy, tropical hop presence. Beginning with pineapple, mango and guava the ride continues into a pleasant citrus finish. The conjunction of malts add an assertive tangy counterbalance to this hop parade to remind you this is a real brazen beast.
name: CB Makumba Double IPA

description:
An unexpected visual bend to an American India Pale Ale, this style is one that stands out in a crowd, or if you’re more
like us — enjoyed at a campsite… with no crowd. This non-traditional IPA is golden in color with an enormous floral/citrus hop aroma and a supporting malt profile.
name: Bent Hop

description: Stone Ruination IPA was the first full-time brewed and bottled West Coast Double IPA on the planet. As craft beer has evolved over the years, so too have techniques for maximizing hop flavors and aromas. When we updated this incarnation in 2015, we employed dry hopping and hop bursting to squeeze every last drop of piney, citrusy, tropical, punk, metal & hard rock essence from the hops that give this beer its hugely assertive character. Now we’ve arrived at its newest evolutionary form by shoving it into the bottle unfiltered (aka sans filtre) and bringing it to you in its most excellently raw form. This beer has always been unbridled. Now it’s unfiltered.
name: Stone Ruination Double IPA 2.0 Sans Filtre

description: Up The Creek is a hoppy behemoth of a beer with its 12.5% ABV well hidden under heavy layers of malt. The hops come through powerfully in the mouth, with rich roasted malt, sweet caramel, and a burst of vinous fruit. The finish is malty sweet and fruity, while the hops dissipate. Use caution or you’ll be Up The Creek!
name: Up the Creek Extreme Ale

description:
Aksamitna struktura, stosunkowo niska goryczka i potężny aromat uzyskany dzięki podwójnemu chmieleniu na zimno.

Smooth structure, relatively low bitterness and powerful aroma obtained thanks to double dry hopping.
name: New England DDH DIPA Simcoe + Mosaic

description: Brewed with malted wheat & oats as well as lactose sugar, and conditioned on an outrageous amount of pumpkin puree, ginger, cinnamon, allspice, clove, Madagascar vanilla beans and Awake Minds coffee roasted for us by out friends at Reanimator. Dry hopped intensely with Mosaic and Citra.
name: Milkshake IPA (Double Pumpkin Spice Latte)

description: Hoppy Feet has been lovingly crafted by combining Premium malt with lots of Amarillo and Columbus Hops. Grapefruit and Pine are balanced on the nose and on the palate by a nutty, dark chocolate, roasted backbone.
name: Hoppy Feet

description: Our flagship beer - a big, citrusy beast of a Double IPA bursting with hop flavor and aroma.
name: King of the Mountain

description: This American style IPA is aggressively hopped at a rate of over 2 lbs. per barrel. Big notes of citrus and pine complement a reserved but firm malt backbone. 65 IBUs.
name: Lot No. 3 IPA

description: Our aggressively hopped DIPA is brewed with a bountiful load of bravo, cascade, citra, simcoe & el dorado hops. Big citrus & tropical fruit are abound with a medium-dry finish.
name: Bartto DIPA

description: Lacking nothing, at ten percent alcohol by volume and 95 International Bitterness Units, the Decadent truly represents all that is self indulgent when it comes to drinking beer.
name: Decadent Imperial IPA

description: This beer is complex and overwhelms the senses, leaving some wondering what it all means. Its deep red copper tone is so intense that it is only matched by the array of flavors that waft all the way across the pallet. Malt, hops, caramel, and bite, this beer has it all. Heavily dry hopped with the latest and greatest of hops, Citra. To be perfectly honest this is almost a triple IPA.
name: Double Rainbow IPA All The Way

description: A barrage of juicy, resinous hop character pounces from the lean malt base of this deep golden-colored DIPA. An impressive American hop expression.
name: Double India Pale Ale

description: West x Three collaboration with Beer52. DIPA Double Dry Hopped with Amarillo and Mosaic
name: DDH DIPA With Amarillo And Mosaic

description:
Hermes Hazy IPA - intensive double dry hopped beer with a vivid fruit flavour, mostly peach.
Amorillo and Mosaic hops were used.
name: Hermes Hazy IPA

description: Double IPA with Mandarina Bavaria &
name: Hard Day DIPA

description:
I Feel The Need, The Need For Beer.

Maverick Killed Goose. That's heavy. Here's an Imperial IPA with four hop varieties from three continents to aid the grieving process. Ella and Summer from Australia, Cashmere from the US and Aramis from France lend a collective profile of tropical fruit and bold lemon citrus with a smooth bitterness on the finish to create a juicy IIPA that is truly world class.

We dedicate this beer to all of closet Top Gun fans, and those who lust for the need for speed!
name: Accelerated Stall Double IPA

description: Look for this IIPA to make an appearance around our anniversary at the end of June. This well balanced IIPA’s 9.1
name: San Diego 71

description: A double IPA in honor of the old man. The grand kids call
name: PAPA Double IPA

description: A lightly hazed hoppy masterpiece with si
name: 08 Hazy IPA

description: This seasonal brew combines the tart sweetness of ripened Blackberries along with an aromatic floral bouquet of fresh Michigan bittering hops, sit back with this beer and enjoy the change of the seasons wherever you are.
name: Blackberry IPA

description:
Brewed to support our friends at Heal the Bay, the all two-row pale malt body takes a back seat to the Citra, Centennial, and New Zealand hops, resulting in a citrus forward, summertime drinking IPA.

The two-row pale malt body takes a back seat to Citra, Centennial, and New Zealand hops for a bright, citrus forward, summertime drinking IPA. Some proceeds from this beer will be donated to our hardworking friends at Heal the Bay (www.healthebay.org). Bay street Santa Monica Surf Spot
name: Heal The Bay IPA

description:
Brewed with big hitting all American hops, The Chief is an India Pale Ale that packs a whole tepee full of taste. Bristling with flavour from the blend of punchy aroma hops, used in copious quantities. Honey orange in colour, with aromas of mango and citrus, rising to a pleasant and balanced bitterness. The finish is dry that leaves you just wanting more!

Hops: Northdown, Chinook, Columbus, Magnum.
name: The Chief

description: Paljas Indian Pale Ale is brewed with 100% pale malts. The 4 selected hops (Tomahawk, Cascade, Saaz and Amarillo) are giving a fresh hoppy aroma and a nice bitterness of 35 IBU. This well balanced IPA is dry-hopped with the special Nelson Sauvin hop, which gives some flavors of Sauvignon Blanc.
name: Paljas IPA

description: A blade for many a pocket, this IPA displays malt in its most elemental form: Pilsner, Oats, and locally grown and malted rye. Mosaic, El Dorado, and Galaxy hops present a sharp, citrus punch while the addition of Simcoe to the dry hop adds a final piney complexity to this easy sipping, hazy IPA.
name: Hawkbill IPA
Smells Like Green Spirit Hazy IPA

description: British malt and ABV meet US hop profile. Dry hopped with Citra, Mosaic and Ahtanum hops.
name: Left Of The Dial IPA

description: Brewed in collaboration with our friends from up north, Fulton Brewing. Double IPA with over 2.8 lb/bbl of hops and fermented with Fulton's house ale yeast. Mosaic shines with additions at the end of boil and whirlpool. Double dry hopped with Idaho 7, Cashmere, and Mosaic lends notes of fresh peaches with a lasting citrus punch.
name: Doncha Know DIPA

description: An extra juicy double IPA bursting with more tropical fruit, mango, citrus, grapefruit and peach flavors. Incredibly dry for a double IPA with little malt backbone setting the stage for the hops.
name: Double Mt Massive IPA

description: This BABBA (Bad Attitude Big Brown Ale) is hella hoppy, with resin, citrus and pine hop flavor from intense hopping and dry hopping. Pity the fools who don’t like Baracus…
name: Baracus

description:
For 20 years our passion for brewing and our obsession with hops have challenged traditional styles and expectations for beer. So it’s only fitting we commemorate this momentous occasion by crafting a liquid ode to bold brewing that satisfies your hop thirst and pays homage to our flagship San Diego brewery, located on Citracado Parkway (which itself pays homage to the citrus and avocado agricultural history of the region).

“Citracado” also teases the two key ingredients of this beer. “Citra” refers both to the juicy gem of a hop and its citrusy (and tropical) aromas and flavors. “Cado” inspired us to utilize wonderful, native avocado flower honey. Combine the two and the result pours like silk and abounds with enough hops to match our excitement for reaching this 20-year milestone. We thank you sincerely for the years of support and pledge that we will, as always, strive to live up to the reasons for your loyalty!
name: 20th Anniversary Citracado IPA

description: A full bodied single hopped Double IPA. Pounds and pounds of Columbus hops contribute to this beer’s flavor. Smooth finish.
name: Dan K's DIPA

description: Atlas Double I.P.A. is exactly what people around the US and the world are looking for in a big hoppy bold West Coast D.I.P.A., but with the drinkability you do not find in a lot of beers this style. We have balanced the strong bitterness you would expect this beer to have with huge dank aromas and a malt back bone that makes this beer so easy to drink. "This beer is right up my alley" is what Stone Brewing Founder Greg Koch said upon drinking this tasty elixir of the gods, which could only be named after one.
name: Atlas Double IPA

description:
Napoleon Complex is a small-statured pale ale with a larger than life attitude. Ignoring, the industry standard of diminutive hop presence and mild manner, this pale ale will have most IPA's contemplating their inadequacy. Little beer, big flavor, even bigger ego.

(Wicked Weed previously listed this as a session IPA, but the new label says "Hoppy Pale Ale".)
name: Napoleon Complex

description: Intensely hazy new england style brewed with waimea comet and mo
name: Double Hazy New England IPA

description: A biting, bitter, tongue bruiser of an ale. With a name like Hopslam, what did you expect?
name: Hopslam Ale

description: Brewed with an obscene amount of malts and hops. This rye-based double IPA comes across earthy and spicy with a wonderful, rich malt/hop balance. Very full-bodied and beautifully constructed.
name: Bittersweet Lenny's R.I.P.A.

description:
We're not saying Zach Morris endorsed this beer, but he would trade Slater's trophies without hesitation for a 4-pack of this hazy, rosé IPA.

Beer is cool. To make this beer even more hella cool, we added loads of hibiscus, creating the most juicy, bodacious beverage of the summer -- a rosé IPA. So drink Rosé All Day. Drink RAD!
name: RAD Hazy Rosé IPA

description: Big flavor, intense pine and citrus aroma. We keep the malt profile clean in this Imperial IPA to let the love lights shine on the fine Northwest hops.
name: Alpha Centauri Binary IPA
Triple Beam Laser Dreams - Hazy Triple IPA

description: Hopped with copius amounts of specialty hops giving it a noticable orange flavor and aroma. Smooth and citrusy.
name: Hazy Double IPA

description:
Bold, complex flavors with a solid malt backbone and assertive hop profile, along with cold conditioning, give this beer its crisp, clean, hoppy finish.

Deep amber-to-orangish in color; pours with a nice, creamy head; huge hop aroma of citrus, pine and grapefruit rind notes with a big, complex, and intense hop flavor that lingers for a very long time. The malt flavor up-front turns dry and crisp; full bodied and a dry finish with a pleasant, long lasting, hop aftertaste and beautiful lace left in the glass. Stowaway leaves you wanting more.
name: Stowaway IPA

description: Hazy Double IPA with Vic Secret, Mosaic, Galaxy,
name: A.H.A.B (Another Hazy Ass Beer)

description: This next generation beer descends from our flagship IPA, Hops of Wrath. Son of Wrath comes into this world angrier than his father with a strong grip of hops and a malt backbone sturdy enough to withstand a rough childhood. Son of Wrath offers complex hop aromas of citrus, tropical fruit and floral with balanced malt sweetness and an assertive bitter finish. Enjoy the Son of Wrath in his rebellious phase, though you may need some therapy after.
name: Son of Wrath Double IPA

description: Sushi Rice Double IPA - Tired Hands second colaboration with chef Jesse Ito of Royal Sushi & Izakaya. Brewed with raw wheat & dry hopped aggressively with Galaxy, Nelson Sauvin, & Crystal. Conditioned on nearly 300lbs of Jesse's fully cooked and dressed sushi rice.
name: Royal Double IPA

description: Sold on Scandinavian flights, brewed by Mikkeller for t
name: Northern Trails

Mash hopping, hop forwarding, First wort hopping, hop backing and dry hopping were all employed to create a huge hop flavor and aroma. Distinct tropical and citrus fruit juice aroma.

Milkshake DIPA With Strawberry And Banana Puree

description: The hipster guy is back but he’s been through the ringer. His year-round beanie and non-prescription fashion glasses were finally done in by this piney, west coast style IPA with the perfect blend of citra, amarillo and simcoe hops.

description: When your everyday IPA no longer satisfies your craving for hoppy nectar, you have experienced a lupulin threshold shift and the only cure is more hops! Palate Shifter is brewed using American grown hops and dry hopped for an extra aromatic kick!

description: After eight years and 86 unique versions of our Hop Project series, we believe that we have hit upon the perfect blend of hops for our year-round IPA. It's brewed with pale barley, wheat, and oats, and generously hopped with Citra and Mosaic hops. Is it the perfect IPA? It is to us - but we'll let you decide!

description: Dry hopped with citrus grapefruit and trop
name: Cloud 8 ( Hazy Ipa)

description: Double IPA #3 is a 9% ABV Black IPA made with the classic “C” hops (Cascade, Centennial and Columbus) with lots of Amarillo in the dry hop. English barley malts and midnight wheat create a velvety smooth base on which these hops shine.

description: Inspired by late night stories around the fire, Muskoka Mad Tom will instantly grab your attention. Dry-hopped with Chinook and Centennial hops, this IPA has a vibrant aroma, depth of flavour, and crisp citrusy undertow like no other.
name: Mad Tom IPA

description:
Coming back from a day at the coast, you crest the summit of Highway 17 and head down into the Santa Clara Valley. But just as the beauty of the valley opens up before you, your eyes widen at the never ending curve the locals call "The Valley Surprise".

Our double IPA is just as exhilarating as its namesake. After being greeted with pleasant aromas of citrus and dank pine, a light malt backbone yields to the onslaught of hops that will make your palate beg for mercy. Flavored of tropical fruit, pine, and citrus finally give way to a bitter yet balanced finish.

Hold on tight, because this ride is full of surprises!
name: Valley Surprise Double IPA

description: NOW SHOCK COLLAR - Sneaky Pete is a blend of five hop types: Simcoe, Glacier, Centennial,Vanguard and Hallertauer, with Simcoe playing the dominant at 30%. In addition, three separate malts were used: Honey Malt, Rye Malt, and Munich Malt. The brew has a copious aroma of white grapefruit, citrus overtones, a complex rich middle and long flavors in the finish; a real beauty. Finished with wild clover honey.
name: Sneaky Pete Rebranded as Shock Collar

description: Our Barrels are stored in the Basement of the brewing barnhouse of the HillDevils located in the Wouwse Plantage, Holland. Every barrel has it's own unique characteristic flavours wich melt with the beer. We Aged the EXPLODED Double IPA in a Maker's Mark Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whisky Barrel for a period of 8 month's.
name: Basement Barrel Aged - Maker's Mark - BA/DIPA

description: Indulge in a beloved India pale ale with its bright, citru
name: Naughty Lemon Hazy IPA

description: Heavier Handed is one of a series of special limited-run beers in the styles that are more extreme or unusual. This Artisan Beer is in celebration of our new French oak tanks, called "Foudres". Tons of fresh, wet hops from Washington State power through this stepped up version of our seasonal IPA.
name: Heavier Handed

description:
Point the Way IPA is our ode to the hop-crazed patrons of Los Angeles. Its light malt body elevates the citrus zest, tropical and pine notes contributed by a generous hop dosing. At 5.9%, this sessionable West-Coast IPA finishes dry for optimal repeatability.

DIFFERENCE FROM ORIGINAL RECIPE:
To balance these aggressive hop profiles we’ve switched to English specialty malts, which produce a lighter hue and replace the caramel notes with a very slight toast. These changes will bump the ABV from 5.2% to 5.9%, maintaining Point the Way's low-ABV status while optimizing hop flavor and complexity.
name: Point The Way IPA

description: Citra and Mosaic cosmically coalesce in this juicy, transcendent beer thanks to a special technique called "hop-bursting." Deliberately small. Beyond modern.
name: Meta Modern Session IPA

description: All The Way is a session IPA brimming with hops yet with lower alcohol level than an ordinary American IPA. Its well balanced body is backed up by Amarillo, Cascade, Citra and Columbus hops. Take a seat!
name: All The Way

description: Citra, Mosaic, Centennial, S
name: DIPA Love

description:
We are pleased to welcome East Coast IPA to the Greene King IPA family; a bold, brash and beautiful American style IPA with lip-smacking bitterness and mellow citrus and tropical fruit flavours.
Bringing American hops to the East of England, this hand crafted brew combines the heady aroma of American hops with the refreshment of traditional British ales.
Cold, gold and insanely drinkable.
Amarillo in the copper and as a late hop gives East Coast IPA its citrus fruits, floral and spicy notes. Centennial and Citra add more citrus and soft tropical fruit. Pale malt gives a clean, easy-drinking body. Hops: Amarillo, Centennial and Citra.
name: East Coast IPA

description: This Double IPA first differentiates itself from most DIPAs with its deep red color. The flavor profile then sets this beer further apart from other DIPAs as grapefruit, citrus, tropical fruit, and a nice malt character back up and balance out the lingering hops and solid bitterness that is more characteristic of this style. The alcohol is undeniably present, but not overpowering.
name: Renny Red DIPA

description: Wheat and oats provide a smooth mouthfeel while the DDH of El Dorado and Amarillo bring flavors and aromas of pine, stone fruit, pear and pineapple.
name: El Dorado Hazy IPA

description: Hazy IPA / Vic Secre
name: INU HAZY IPA Vic Secret + Mosaic

description:
It all began in September, last year, when we invited our “Rainbow Project” collaborators and good friends, Naparbier, to come brew our first DIPA – “Bone King”. Super drinkable, high ABV beers are Naparbier’s bread and butter, but was something of learning experience for us, being the first time we used Dextrose in a brew (which increases sugar content and therefore ease of fermentation, along with decreasing fusel alcohol making for that cleaner, more IPA-er flavour you know and love!) Well that learning experience turned out to be an absolute treat, resulting in incredible feedback and not only our and Naparbier’s first (of many, hopefully) 100 rating on ratebeer.com, but also a feature in the top 50 beers of the 2014. Excellent news all round, except it was so limited, hen’s teeth were regularly mentioned…
 
We couldn’t simply let it lie, but simply repeating the collab recipe felt a little half hearted, so we have sampled, tweaked, sampled, then tweaked some more in order to bring you the best final product possible! This marks yet another milestone, as it will be the UK’s first canned DIPA too! As mentioned, the dextrose makes for a much cleaner taste profile, meaning you will hopefully be able to taste the vast complexities alongside how much care and attention has been put into this big, juicy, hoppy, aromatic, in your face double IPA.
name: Skull King

description:
Gotowi do walki? Wyciągamy najcięższe działa jakie są dostępne na rynku. Chmiele Galaxy, Citra, Mosaic na jednej scenie. Największe gwiazdy stają do walki o tytuł Freak Fightu wieczoru!

Are you ready to fight? We pull out the biggest weapon on the market! Galaxy, Citra and Mosaic hops are ready to fight on the same stage. The biggest stars are ready to fight for Freak Fight title!
name: Freak Fight - DDH DIPA

description: Our head brewer Chris is moving on (it really has been a pretty big year) He studied the arts and acting for 8 years and was just really helping us out to begin with, wound up passing all of his exams and kind of fell into brewing really for the last 5 years! However the move prompted a reassessment and we are all incredibly impressed by his shunning of a comfortable life in favour of striking out and doing what he truly loves. A lesson for us all. His last brew is an DIPA with Amarillo, Citra, Sorachi Ace and notes of Piña Colada.

description: State of Mind is a very hop forward session IPA. Dominating the palate and aroma are notes of tropical fruit and orange with background hints of grapefruit and pine. While being full flavoured, this session IPA is amazingly light bodied, crisp and extremely drinkable. Big taste to satisfy the hop bomb lover at a lower ABV.
name: State of Mind
Don LACO Los Moles Hazy IPA

description: INU HAZY IP
name: INU HAZY IPA Nelson

description: Like a stamp on a tramp, this beer is about not so subtle seduction.  Soft but complex malts, Chambly yeast, sweet orange peel, Columbus, Amarillo, and Centennial hops have merged to create a bodacious Belgian IPA.

description: Hazy, full bodied, juicy, low bitterness, this beer has all the desired traits of a New England style IPA. We fermented this beer using London 3 yeast giving it a soft hazy look and with Mosaic, Citra, Azaaca, and Galaxy hops added in the whirlpool and the dry hop this beer is straight juice without the pulp!

name: Petronius DIPA

description: Big Stump’s Flagship Hazy IPA. Additions of un-malted flaked wheat and red wheat add a pillowy mouth feel while the Mosaic dominant dry hop contributes lush tropical notes.

description: Brewed for a neighborhood with passion for the dank and delicious, Central District IPA is dry hopped with boatloads of Amarillo, Citra and Denali. Notes of orange cream and sweet pineapple rest on a soft, wheat foundation. It’s fluffy and frosty just like the neighborhood’s recreational flora.

description: Our West Coast Style IPA. Built with American and British Pale Malts and intensely hopped in the brew kettle. We used a small amount of Orange Blossom Honey to make the IPA finish crisp. Triple Dry Hopped to provide you with the aroma of citrus and tropical fruits.

description: Inspired by the Three Weavers Community, our West Coast IPA is bright and laden with notes of tropical fruits. Brewed with two-row barley, a tough of English crystal malt and loaded with new age American hops, Expatriate is home no matter where you are. Brewed and bottled by Three Weavers Brewing Company, Inglewood, California.

To allow the intense tropical hop flavours to shine, we used a simple malt bill of Pale Ale and Oats - for this Double IPA, it really is all about the hops.

Savor this rich, jet black IPA - overflowing with characteristics of coffee, dark chocolate, and fresh citrus. Deep roasted malt flavors provide support for a bold mix of bright and bitter West Coast hops. We promise, this is one form of Death you’ll want to seek out.

name: Raglan T-Rex (Mangosaurus) Imperial IPA

description: Kicking back and relaxing with a session beer requires little more than a couch, some free time, and a few pals. Slow Ride Session IPA is up for this easy-going challenge, starting with a pour of sheened gold and plenty of fluffy, white foam. A blend of seven hop varieties, led by exotic Mosaic and Nelson Sauvin, twist together brilliant tropical scents of melon, peach, lime and grapefruit for a vividly fruity aroma. The flavor mirrors the aroma, while balancing a malty-sweet yet clean start and hoppy bitterness in the back. Light bodied and extra quaffable, Slow Ride Session IPA brings the finish line to you.

and a bright citrusy hop flavor!

description: You think you know good IPA? We do too, and this one’s it. This is a straightforward, full-throttle, American IPA—nothing fancy here; just hop flavor and lots of it. Its hazy blonde malt body has just enough heft to carry the citrus and floral hop notes straight to your palate making Know Good perfect for today, or any day. When it comes to IPA, we know what good is.

Thick body and sweetness provide the platform for notes of ripe mango, tangy passion fruit and juicy tangerine to sing, backed up by light resinous hop accents.

ALC 8% VOL 440ML

Aroma & Flavour: Ripe mango, passion fruit and tangerine, with a light, sweet malt profile
Body: Full-bodied, smooth and juicy

ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

description: In the 1960s, before Vail Village was paved and closed to vehicles, "hookiebobbing" referred to those committed fools who, while on skis, grabbed onto the bumper of passing cars to tow them up to the lifts. Our IPA is a Colorado approach to the American take of an English classic. Three aggressive yet floral American hops and one hop from Down Under team together to make a bright, citrusy and floral India Pale Ale. A deep caramel malt helps to balance the bitterness of the hops and lets the complex hop bill shine.

description: Block Party is a double IPA that brings a bit of the old school bitterness to the new school haze. Amarillo, Chinook, Columbus, Simcoe, and Cryo Citra give this beer an explosive tropical and dank aroma with some lingering grain on the finish.
name: Block Party Hazy Double IPA

description:
Hazy Session IPA Brewed with Strawberry, Vanilla, and Super Juicy American and German Hops.

But I'd Have to Charge
Damn Right this is an Insane Beverage
Your Taste Buds are Waiting la-la la-la la.

This DIPA features a 20g/L dry hop of Azzaca, Motueka and Galaxy.

Juicy - Soft - Complex - Intense

description: This deeply juicy stunner in the mold of City of the Sun and Booming Rollers will be replacing Aurora in the seasonal line-up next year. While our beloved red rye IPA will undoubtedly be missed, we think you’ll agree with our decision once you get a face-full of this outrageously tasty IPA. Brewed with Denali, Ekuanot, Citra, and Centennial hops, Critical Band is a blast wave of pineapple, papaya, and pink grapefruit over a crisp, restrained malt bill, before wrapping up in a soft, round finish that leaves you with warm feelings and an intense desire for another sip.

description: Named for Pako (say “PACO”) the dog (No wait, Pako’s not a dog!) This full flavored, fully hop-evident IPA will have the hopheads rejoicing. Explosive hop aroma from a pungent Simcoe/columbus blend.

description: Mosaic hops naturally give off aromas of guava and mango, lending a unique sweetness to the hop character of this pale ale. To build upon the tropical attributes of the hops, we've added a healthy dose of mango. Mango Mosaic Pale Ale is a well-balanced montage of fruit flavors, fresh aromas, and refreshingly crisp goodness.

description: Session IPA. Pale golden color with soft lemon and melon esters and a bready malt body. Dry hopped with Centennial and experimental hops from the Yakima Valley. If you like a hoppy IPA, but don't always care for the higher alcohol, try an El Conquistador XPA.

It is dry hopped with ample amounts of Simcoe and Cascade hops that will send you into hop nirvana. Enjoy this Doubleback Double IPA on a fall day with full flavored foods and goods friends!

Brewed with an abundance of fresh Citra and
Cascade, this IPA boasts a big biting hop profile layered with
ripe tropical fruit, juicy citrus, and pine

description: Thorn St. and North
name: 92104 Hazy IPA
Milkshake DIPA With Passion Fruit Pulp

description: Loral hops were release in 2016 and quickly became one of our favorite New varieties. It was highlighted in our Stone hop revolver single ipa series, and with the featured hop in our hugely popular 2017 summer seasonal beer: Stone ghost hammer IPA. Then there's Dr. Rudi , which has been around since 1976. Originally known as a super alpha, this hop brings classic resin and piney notes, which pair it perfectly with the floral citrusy aroma of loral. Traditionalist GenX meets adventurous Millennial. What do they talk about? Nothing, hops don't talk. Together however, they speak. It's apparent that a pairing like this was bound to happen. At Stone we call it inevitable.
name: Stone Loral & Dr. Rudi's Inevitable Adventure

description: Small batch brews are one-off beers from our pilot kit, or trial beers we have brewed with limited availability.
name: Small Batch: DIPA v3

description:
With double the malt and triple the hops this Double Dark Red IPA is an amped up version of our legendary Dark Red IPA.

The use of caramel and chocolate malts give it the trademark dark velvety red colour. With numerous late hop additions and at 100 IBU's it’s in your face hop aroma and flavour with notes of resin and citrus, but the rich malty body balances this and at 10% ABV this is all soothed by a mellow alcohol warmth.
name: Double Dark Red IPA

description: Plenty of late-kettle & dry hops to give this beer a pronounced citrus & floral aroma.
name: Saturday Night Lumberjack

description:
I’ll give you a beer you can’t refuse! Na 3 jaar lang het recept te perfectioneren is de Hopfather precies zoals wij hem willen hebben. Een fruitige hopexplosie met een laag alcohol percentage.

De grote hoeveelheden Mosaic en Simcoe hoppen zorgen voor een krachtige aroma van ananas, mango’s en lychees. Een tropisch feest in een glas! Deze IPA bevat minimale bitterheid omdat alle hoppen tijdens de whirlpool en dry-hop worden toegevoegd.
name: Hopfather

description:
A Double IPA brewed with Citra Lupulin Powder and re-fermented on Mango purée, Funny Trees features a fruity and slightly funky fermentation character provided by Brettanomyces.

Brett is a species of wild yeast normally seen as a threat in the brewery, but we love the fruity and funky flavors it can produce when used with intention.

Blended with the flavor of mango and and potent Citra lupulin powder, then a healthy dry-hop with refreshing Citra + fruit-forward Mandarina hops. The result is a crisp, flavor-forward Double India Pale Ale less concerned with bitterness and more focused on pleasing the palate with a panoply of layers.

Grain Bill: 2-Row and Wheat. Hops: Citra (lupulin powder), Citra, and Mandarina.
name: Funny Trees Mango Brett DIPA

description: American-style double IPA brewed with 3.5 pounds of hops per barrel. Enough bitterness, hop flavor and aroma to challenge any man of steel.
name: Kryptonite Imperial IPA

description: Purposely cloudy. Done as they do in the northeast, not because it is easy, but to accentuate the the hops! Or so “they” say. Ours is a blend from near and far with the addition of real Mango juice and flavors to tropical juice up this already juicy IPA
name: L'Hazy Mango IPA

description: English style DIPA with caramel color and malty body with generous hop aroma and flavor. Citrus(not piney) hop profile and a very smooth finish.
name: Lindencross DIPA

description:
Exploration and innovation have always been hallmarks of mankind. The same spirit that sent pathfinders, like Captain Cook, sailing from Britain to the shores of Australia and the rocky coastlines of Alaska animates today's trailblazers. Wherever you find a frontier, be it the Final Frontier of our Milky Way, the Last Frontier of the Great Land, or the frontiers of scientific knowledge, there you will also find dedicated men and women, taking risks to break trail for the rest of us.

One of the new trails being blazed on the frontier of beer is the style known as White India Pale Ales. Galaxy White IPA represents a significant new landmark on that trail. With its use of fresh kumquats, Indian coriander, and black peppercorns, Galaxy pays homage to the early explorers, who sailed unknown seas in search of rare spices and exotic fruits. Captain Cook travelled from Australia to Alaska, and so have the Galaxy hops used to create this adventurous brew. Just as a true explorer never stands still, the presence of brettanomyces guarantees that Galaxy White IPA will keep evolving in the bottle for years to come.

So take a step from the known into the unknown. Cross the frontier from the commonplace into the extraordinary. Be the first to gaze upon an undiscovered country and return to tell the tale to those timid souls you left behind. After all, there's an entire Galaxy waiting to be explored…
name: Galaxy

description:
Like your favorite hammock, this IPA is perfectly relaxed and balanced. The smoothness of premium barley lies in equilibrium with the hoppiness of a classic American IPA. Kick back and reward yourself with this multiple award-winner.
6.5% ALCHOHOL BY VOL
name: Squatters IPA

description: This Teutonic take on the traditional IPA features spicy German grown hops and an expressive Kolsch yeast. The result is a golden beer with a moderate bitterness and an intensely fruity aroma reminiscent of raspberry and lemon peel. Prost!
name: German Style IPA

description:
15,5 blg Hazy IPA
Pilsner malt, flaked oats, flaked wheat
Galaxy, Mosaic
Danstar Windsor
name: אובך (Hazy IPA / Ovekh / Owech)

description: We maxed out the mash tun to give this beer a full malt body, able to handle big additions of Citra kettle-hops and dry-hops. Enjoy a big tropical fruity nose, big ABV, and big IPA finish. Cheers!
name: Double Citra IPA

description: Fraught with hops complex, vigorous and virile. Endowed with a subtle maly character for a sturdy and balanced ale. Our Award-Winning interpretation of the popular style reflects both the history of the IPA and the distinctive and relatively modern American variation. Cascade and Centennial hops are employed generously and the result is an earthy ale that is most drinkable.
name: IPA

description: Thick and juicy fresh! Brewed with oats, milk sugar and ripe mangoes. Heavily hopped with Citra, Idaho 7, Mosaic and Galaxy!
name: The Big Fat Juicy Mango Milkshake DIPA

description: Pungent fruit aromas and taste abound in this rendition of our DIPA. A metric shit ton of the juiciest hop varieties run rampant in this East Coast style DIPA.
name: Hopstrosity

description: Sweet, juicy mango with tropical hop notes. Finishes with a subtle spicy kick that builds with each sip.
name: Fever Dream
Citra & Equinox DIPA / Extra Hops Series

description: A Bold West Coast Double IPA, 6 different hops contribute complex and juicy hop character. Its dry finish allows the hops to stand out. Signature hops are Calypso, contributing rich tropical flavors, Simcoe, passionfruit and pine and Mosaic, bubble gum and blueberry. All the while, Cascade, Chinook and Herkules provide a grapefruit foundation. At 9.5% ABV and 95 IBUs
name: Big Cranky (Double IPA)

description: Named after the old Southern Pacific line connecting Yuma to L.A. through the Imperial Valley. Expect rich maltiness with a blend of citrusy & spicy west coast hops in this big yet balanced imperial IPA.
name: The Imperial

description: Spy Balloon is our second hazy, focusing in on the things we love about the style: low bitterness, smooth mouthfeel, and juicy hop character. This pint is chock full of three hop varieties new to the brewery: spicy, tropical Ella from Australia; zesty, tangerine-like Mandarina Bavaria from Germany; and piney, fruity Azacca from Washington state. A new base malt joined the party as well, imparting a background of honey-like sweetness for the marriage of hop flavors. A blended and warm fermentation enhanced the fruitiness and lent a funky complexity to this easy drinking pint. The hazy IPA is back and here to stay at Oozlefinch.
name: Spy Balloon Hazy IPA

description: The traditional elements of a classic English IPA have been redefined by American craft beer innovation. This beer is brilliant copper in color and exploding with Warrior, Glacier and Cascade hop character but able to maintain a beautiful balance.
name: Monkey Fist IPA

description: This bold, juicy DDH DIPA is the biggest beer Wild Card have ever done. Extensively dry hopped with Mosaic & Citra for a beer bursting with grapefruit, mango & pineapple notes.
name: DIPA

description:
